The display's abysmally low brightness (for being a flagship category phone) is a huge con. Arguably a far greater sin than the IP65 rating, most people splash water on their phones or spill water on it more than they drown that thing. Besides, the IP rating is for clean water, not salt water, swimming pools or even contaminated drainage water, so it won't help much in those situations. What would've helped tho is a brighter display, seriously Oneplus? Dolby Vision and LTPO4 are THAT important to you? Who cares about that when the phone can't reach at least 1300 nits in 2024. I'm not saying it's dim but it should've been much better for what they promised and additionally, Realme and Vivo have so much better displays, those make this phone look cheap in comparison, especially the Iqoo 12 which is a tier below the Oneplus in pricing but reaches 1400 nits. The jump from 1200 to 1400 nits is more noticeable than the jump from FHD+ to QHD+ on this tiny ahh screen.
 
The speakers are worse than the Vivo X100 Pro and quite boomy overall. Worse than even Realme's GT5 Pro, it seems only Vivo has been able to craft really good speakers in the BBK, I think bass is cool and I love it but proper dynamics/less pumping and a good midrange/treble are more important since those are more audible.
 
The battery is a hit and a miss sort of, the gaming performance is subpar but the web browsing and video playback are close to class leading, I wonder what Oneplus and Oppo do that Vivo, Samsung, etc. don't that makes the gaming battery life so much worse? If the gaming time went up to 8 hours this'd be an extremely well rounded battery phone, charging superbly fast and still having loads of SOT.
 
The performance is my final ick, even if I were to believe that the performance is going to be better for the CPU (which im pretty sure will be true), the thermals aren't promising. The main culprit seems to be the SD 8 Gen 3 which is just as bad as the 8 Gen 1 for gpu at least, it's horrible for thermals. As days go by, I have more and more respect for Vivo's optmisation and cooling, I thought it was the case for the X90 series (after seeing golden reviewers reviews) and the phones this year just confirmed it, Vivo is BBK's king of cooling and squeezing out performance for the same heat. The IQOO 12 and the X100 Pro are better than the ROG Phone 8 in terms of passive cooling. Now either that's a great achievement or it shows Asus's downfall in quality. For how much flak the Dimensity 9300 got (admittedly I too was skeptical) the chip just seems more and more awesome as days go by. Apart from the ISP, I don't think at all that the chipset is a "cheaper" one than Qualcomm's one. Sustained performance matters more than peak and both are quite close between the SD 8 Gen 3 and the D 9300. I think there should be more tiers for the performance mode, as it stands the phones are good at dissipating heat in the current performance modes and a higher tier mode would be appreciated to squeeze out more performance at the cost of thermals. Of course, the current tier should be kept as well for people who don't want the best performance but also not the worst. So basically, I think the performance is more of a current gen Qualcomm problem than Oneplus's so I can let this slide.
 
The saving grace for this phone are the cameras, but only for photography and even then it's all due to Oppo lmao, the processing is superb. The S24 doesn't stand a chance against this now, better sensors across the board with supremely good processing now. The fact that GSM has to compare this phone's cameras to the X100 Pro and the Find X7 Ultra to show its weaknesses is a huge compliment actually, the X100 Pro's huge sensor is just too good, if OP 12's aperture were f/1.4 maybe it could've been closer. Additionally the Find X7 Ultra is just too good for a phone, huge-ish sensor (for a telephoto at least) and 6x native zoom combined with the banger processing is a recipe for success. The 6x photos are good at night and day, nothing crazy but good photos that are usable. UW cam is good now as well. Good job Oneplus and Oppo.
 
Basically, think this phone's main shortcomings are the display, videography and the speakers for now. Videography ain't bad but it's not amazing, it's good tho at least and I'm content with that. The display is NOT as good as the competitors even from BBK themselves, QHD+ sounds cool on paper but 1400 nits look better irl, especially in very sunny conditions. The speakers should've been more clearer, better treble was necessary instead of more bass and for the loudness it provides, the dynamics are poor, everything sounds pump-ey or compressed and that's made worse by the fact that only Oneplus has this quality, Realme and Vivo provide far better sound quality, Vivo provides clarity and Realme provides the similar bass-ey sound but with better dynamics. A shame but it isn't THAT bad. The cameras are great, the battery is only adequate for gamers and great for everyone else, charging is superb, design is cool due to awesome colors. The pricing should've been a bit cheaper though, 50-100 euros cheaper would've made this far more compelling, considering the huge display shortcomings, the Xiaomi 13T pro had a similar brightness to the display too and that's a compelling argument but Vivo's IQOO 12 and the Realme GT5 Pro having so much higher brightness just makes this phone feel less desirable.
